weather_report:
Midday in Subiaco arrives under a gauzy ceiling, the light silvered and soft, as if the day is taking a breath. Expect a light shower to drift through early afternoon, then a gradual unbuttoning of the sky toward late day with scattered clouds and brighter edges. Sunshine will be rationed at first, then more generous by late afternoon; when it appears, the November UV will still bite, so don’t let the mild light fool you. Clarity begins muted and pearly, then sharpens as the showers pass and the air clears.

It’s a usable, gentle day rather than a grand one. Dress in light layers with a breathable shirt, carry a compact umbrella, and keep sunglasses and a dab of sunscreen handy for those sudden blue openings. Good weather for a lingering lunch and a small errand or two while the pavements shine, then a late-afternoon wander when the clouds thin—pick up fresh bread, browse a bookshop, or sit by a café window and watch the streets steam back to life.
